author: Staff Reporter
text:
BSNL has launched its Wi-Fi internet service at the Broadway bus stand, K.K. Nagar RTO and Taluk offices, Vandalur Zoo and Nageshwara Rao park.

The services have been available since March 2. Officials are planning to open more hotspots across south, east and north Chennai.

“We have identified 20 locations in south Chennai and plan to cover them in one month,” said an official spokesperson of BSNL.

The firm had already set up a Wi-Fi hotspot at the shore temple in Mahabalipuram in October, last year.

“We have received good reviews from customers there. We are also looking at tourist spots and bus stands, but will be setting up more depending on the number of users in the zone, user’s position, type of surroundings where they can get download speed up to 8 mbps,” the official added.

Customers will be able to use the Wi-Fi service free of charge for the first 15 minutes, and to continue services, they will have to purchase e-coupons through the access device for different durations, volumes and validity periods. The coupons can be used at any BSNL Wi-Fi zone in south and west India. The hotspots are being set up in partnership with M/s. Quadgen Wireless.

For details call Ph: 1800 425 5300 or visit http://qfi.rocks
title: BSNL launches Wi-Fi hotspots in city
